title: Drawing, "Design for a Sedan Chair", ca. 1775
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and red, green yellow and gray watercolor over graphite on heavy, textured cream laid paperboard
markings:
Watermark siilar ot Churchill 434 at right
Cooper Union Museum stamp: Museum for the Arts of Decoration [Lugt 457c]
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Charles B. Alexander
description: Three-quarter view of a sedan chair diminutively decorated with cartouches  containing bird and cupid, and circular medallions with chain-like swags. Tassels hang at corners of roof line and an urn draped with swags crowns the roof.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Sedan Chair", ca. 1775.
ca. 1775. Pen and black ink; brush and red, green yellow and gray watercolor over graphite on heavy, textured cream laid paperboard. Gift of Mrs. Charles B. Alexander. 1900-1-6.
